required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Percutaneous Electrolysis and Vacuum Myofascial Therapy deviceTrial.
clinical_study.official_title: Percutaneous Electrolysis and Vacuum Myofascial Therapy Device in the Treatment of Lateral Epicondylalgia: A Single-Blind Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: The concept of epicondylitis refers to the manifestation of pain in the area of insertion of the epicondile muscles, and that it is accompanied by limitation functional. A tendinopathy is characterized as a process of degeneration, with fibroblast proliferation and disorganization of the fibers of collagen. This tendon pathology especially affects the epicondyle extensors and especially the first and second radial and short extensor carpal.

detailed_description.textblock: Experimental group will be treated Therapeutic Percutaneous Electrolysis and Vacuum Myofascial Therapy device once week for four weeks associated with eccentric exercises devices at home and the control group will be included 10 sessions of ultrasound pulsatil therapy (US) and massage associated with eccentric exercises devices at home.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A specialist physician will be diagnosed the epicondylitis

primary_outcome.measure: The intensity of pain in epicondylitis
primary_outcome.description: A 10-point Numerical Pain Rating Scale (NPRS; 0: no pain, 10: maximum pain) will be used to assess the patients' current level of elbow pain, and the worst and lowest level of pain experienced in the preceding week in the elbow area.

secondary_outcome.measure: The intensity of pain in epicondylitis
secondary_outcome.description: A 10-point Numerical Pain Rating Scale (NPRS; 0: no pain, 10: maximum pain) will be used to assess the patients' current level of elbow pain, and the worst and lowest level of pain experienced in the preceding week in the elbow area.
Measured by a two branches egoniomter

secondary_outcome.measure: Pressure pain thresholds in epicondylitis trigger points
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure pain thresholds (PPTs) will be measured with a pressure algometer (Baseline)
The multidimensional health related quality of life

PRTEE is designed to evaluate pain and disability in subjects with lateral elbow tendinopathy. A 10-point Numerical Pain Rating Scale (NPRS; 0: no pain, 10: maximum pain) will be used to assess the patients' current level of elbow pain, and the worst and lowest level of pain experienced in the preceding week in the elbow area.

arm_group.description: Therapeutic Percutaneous Electrolysis and Vacuum Myofascial Therapy device once week for four weeks associated with eccentric exercises devices at home.
The multimodal physical therapy program includes 10 sessions of ultrasound pulsatil therapy (US) and massage associated with eccentric exercises devices at home.

intervention.description: Therapeutic Percutaneous Electrolysis and Vacuum Myofascial Therapy device once week for four weeks associated with eccentric exercises devices at home.
The multimodal physical therapy program includes 10 sessions of ultrasound pulsatil therapy (US) and massage associated with eccentric exercises devices at home.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients of both sexes, aged between 18 and 60 years, in an active state of pain and with a diagnosis of one month of evolution.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are pregnant, have pacemakers and those surgically operated patients who have been treated with electrolysis and Vacuum Myofascial Therapy Device a month earlier
